content:
Duration: full-day

Time Topic
09:30-09:45 Welcome and Environment Check
Ensure participants have access to all necessary tools (Docker, compiler, CMake, MPI, PDI, HDF5, Python, Dask)
09:45-10:15 HPC I/O and Workflow Complexity
Challenges in structured output, runtime filtering, and in situ visualization
10:15–10:45 PDI Architecture and Core Principles
Data exposure, events, plugins, and YAML configuration model
10:45–11:00 Break
11:00–12:30 Structured File Output with HDF5
Using the PDI-HDF5 plugin for parallel structured output.
Hands-on Session 1: Instrumenting a simulation with PDI and configuring HDF5 output
12:30–13:30 Lunch Break
13:30–14:50 user-code and pycall plugins
Triggering native C callbacks and Python scripts declaratively.
Hands-on Session 2: Integrating user-code and pycall into the simulation workflow
14:50-15:00 Break
15:00–16:00 In situ data processing with DEISA
Dynamic data selection and analytics at runtime.
Hands-on Session 3: Adding DEISA to the simulation and inspecting its effect
16:00–16:30 Demonstration: in situ visualization with Catalyst.
Running Catalyst visualizations and combining plugins into a unified pipeline.
Wrap-up and Q&A
title: Program
